adjectives.description: accountable (comparative more accountable, superlative most accountable)

entries.meaning: Obliged, when called upon, to answer (for oneâ€™s deeds); answerable.
examples: Every man is accountable to God for his conduct.
You will be held accountable for your misdemeanors.

entries.meaning: Obliged to keep accurate records (of property or funds).
Liable to be called on to render an account.
(rare) Capable of being accounted for; explicable; explainable.
